oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A dead Sorcerer, name !nuin|kuiten, asked by the narrators father for rain; which speedily came. In the Katkop dialect, by Dia!kwain (L V.-14. 5068rev.-5078-rev.). Dia!kwain's father, Xaa-ttin, prays to his ancestor, the dead rainmaker !nuin-|kui-ten, for rain. 1) Date on p.5070v: 25 July, 2) This story is found in Book V-14.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: How Xaa-ttin asked (or prayed to) the dead magician (named !nuin-|kui-ten) for rain, which was speedily bestowed
